@rithviknishad

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7432
activity.text: Production release v24.12.0 | March week 3

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7359
activity.text:
I understand that we are trying to handle it in the root. 

Validating the options.length for placeholder text will lead to display 'No options available' instead of  'Choose of an option' at the first render.

Here we bring data based on some other action. (for eg. based on what city is selected)

If we rely on options.length in the selectMenu itself, we loose the 'choose an option' placeholder initially and tend to display the 'no option available'. This is not the right way. Either we should handle it at where we use the component
or 
Another approach to handle is to move away from showing it in placeholder and displaying an option when the selectmenu is clicked as 'no option available'(disabled thereby cannot select this as well)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7359
activity.text:
> Wouldn't this be better if we moved this logic to the Select Menu component itself so it'd be applicable in all use cases?

Since the logic of either disabling or the placeholder text 'No options available' relies on the length of the option, taking that into selectmenu component is not viable unless we bring in a new prop to configure that again. So,  'options.length' is a good to have in the component which is utilising the SelectFormField(SelectMenuV2)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7359
activity.text: Handle no option available case when local body returns empty response

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7355
activity.text:
No, the form will not be submitted.  The logical validation is present.
What I am mentioning here is the UI ambiguity on the dropdown which is not handling the 'no options' scenario

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7355
activity.text:
@rithviknishad @aparnacoronasafe 
I would like to propose two solutions for this
Solution 1: disable the select when the result option array is empty and show the placeholder of 'No option available'. Also, handle the option length logic in the select component. so that Listbox.Options will not be rendered if empty array is passed for options. 
Solution 2: In the SelectMenuV2 component, do a check for the options array length and render the ListBox.Options with passed values when it is not empty and show 'No option found' disabled option in the ListBox when it is empty. 

Let me know your thoughts on this.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7355
activity.text: Yes, it is. Looks like there exists some districts without local bodies where the no option case is not handled in the dropdown

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#7355
activity.text: @rithviknishad Can you please assign this to me? Also, please let me know your thoughts on the issue
